result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall Jon Buersken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Pierce County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $2,252.00 Fine must be paid on or before April 17, 2018 or a 45 day jail commitment may be imposed. $50 IID surcharge is included in this amount.
180 days jail ordered. Defendant is to sit the first 48 hours without huber, defendant will then be furloughed until June 14, 2017 at 10 AM. Release date: October 24, 2017
26 month revocation of driver license. Credit for administrative suspension.

IID for a period of 3 years to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.  IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY.
Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan must be completed.
$200.00 DNA Anlaysis Surcharge due on or before April 17, 2018 or a 4 day jail commitment may be imposed.

records.addlTxt:
3:44 Defendant Marshall Jon Buersken in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: amends to misd 4th offense based on ruling in Polk County, will file an amended information. Guilty to Ct#1, dismiss Ct#2. TEST .226.  Requests sentencing guidelines. Atty Davis and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to amended Ct#1, which will be contained in the amended information. Davis stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS . Atty Davis addresses sentencing; requesting a deviation of the guidelines. Def addresses the Court.
Court:  Fine  $ 2452 1 year to pay 
  3 years  Revocation of License, credit any administrative suspension.
  180 Days Jail ordered. Def to sit 1st 48 hours for huber starting today. Will be furloughed until May 26, 2017 at 7pm . May serve his time in Washington or Polk, as long as their is no cost to Pierce County. If Def is not sitting his time in Washington or Polk County, must report to Pierce County.  Release date will be October 5, 2017. Provide written notice as to where Def will be serving his time.
 Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan
 IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY  IID for a period of 3 yrs to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on April 17, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

from Judge Boles re: yes if your clients agree and waive rights to have you here on the record, before the hearing start.
from Atty Davis to be allowed to appear via phone.
from Atty Davis re: oral ruling on Polk County collateral attack postponed til January 19, 2017. ADA Thorie agrees this matter should be scheduled for a motion hearing.
from Atty Davis re: requesting these matters be continued.

Thorie addresses the status of the case. Waiting for Polk Co case to be completed. Set this case out 60 days for plea hearing.

from Atty Davis re: oral ruling in Polk County was bumped and has not been reset, continue with Monday's hearing and requests client be excused from hearing if it is going to be used for scheduling purposes.  *Judge gone until 09/12.  JA checked w/ADA Thorie who stated no objection to DF appearing via phone on 09/12 and felt a MH should be set to address Motions filed 10/14/15.  JA advised Atty. Davis via email.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Court reviews charges and minimum and maximum penalties with defendant. Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
